name: Rhythm Warriors
description:
Take fate into your own hands.

The world's greatest warriors are unimaginably fast and agile, having mastered the intricacies of physics and death. To storm through the city of Maiyo and challenge your misfortune, you'll have to hit the conveniently-timed weak spots in their conveniently-rhythmic movement.

...I hope you've got a good sense of rhythm.

Features
  • Challenging rhythm-action gameplay
  • Four playable characters
  • Four unique stages
  • Five original compositions (available on Spotify!), four of which are playable songs
  • A four-stage story mode with multiple difficulty levels
  • Custom beatmap compatibility
  • Remappable controls
  • Pausing
  • A bunch of other cool accessibility options, including no-fail

As of release ver. 1.0.0.0, this game comes with three custom charts. I do not own these songs. I am not going to sell copyrighted material anywhere, so if this game ever goes paid, they'll all be removed (unless I can get permission!).

Roadmap

Okay so that's cool and all, but are you going to make the game better??

Yeah, probably. If I feel like it! Stuff I should add before and after release:

  • Gamepad support
  • Integrated level editor
  • Dialogue boxes (like FNF does, in all its glory)
  • New characters
  • New stages
  • Story mode path for each character, which also means three new songs for each path (ack, my poor creative juices!!)
  • Fixing the critical audio bug that seems impossible to fix because of GMS2
  • And also perhaps altering the engine itself because there's no anti-mashing yet
Credits
  • Art, music, programming, writing, planning, suffering: Xander A
  • Voice acting: Emma F, hikimango, Paddy B, MIKO
  • Promo art: hikimango
  • Violin: Frederick Yang

This game was created for my NSW Year 12 Industrial Technology: Multimedia major work.

System Requirements
  • Windows 7+ (idk if it works on older versions, but probably)
  • OpenGL support on your GPU (if you have a decent computer... you're set)
  • 1GB RAM
  • like 50MB of free space
